Imagine you are at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and you have been assigned a task by Professor McGonagall. Your task is to visit a series of magical artifacts. The artifacts are owned by your favorite Hogwarts legends. You must visit each character in a specific order to get their artifact: starting from the root character, going to the left character subtree first and then moving to the right character subtree. This is known as a pre-order traversal. You decide to write a function to solve this problem. What is the output of the function? Briefly explain what the function does.

You are a master chef preparing a delicious salad for a prestigious culinary competition. The ingredients need to be collected in a very specific order to ensure the flavors blend perfectly. The ingredients are organized in a hierarchical manner, starting with the base ingredient and branching out to secondary and tertiary ingredients. To get them in the right order, you must traverse from the base ingredient to the left sub-ingredients before moving on to the right sub-ingredients. This process is known as a pre-order traversal. You decide to write a function to solve this problem. What is the output of the function? Briefly explain what the function does.

As a curator of a renowned music festival, you are tasked with organizing the band line-ups based on different music genres. The genres are structured in a hierarchical tree where you start with the main genre and branch out to sub-genres. To schedule the performances, you must visit each genre starting from the main genre, then visit the left sub-genre before moving on to the right sub-genre. This approach, known as a pre-order traversal, helps you get the line-up in the desired order. You decide to write a function to solve this problem. What is the output of the function? Briefly explain what the function does.
